title: In Streaming Era, CW Network’s Value to Its Owners Has Diminished
sub_head: ViacomCBS and WarnerMedia rethink partnership as their priorities shift to their new platforms, Paramount+ and HBO Max
body:
WarnerMedia and ViacomCBS Inc.’s decision to ponder a sale of some or all of the CW Network is a reflection of dramatic changes within the two companies and the entertainment industry, people familiar with the matter said.
The CW Network has long been a valuable outlet for the programming of joint owners WarnerMedia and ViacomCBS and a healthy source of licensing fees from Netflix Inc., which has frequently streamed CW shows once they have aired.
